title: St Benedict's College, Randalstown
text:
St Benedict's College is a <a href="Secondary%20education">secondary school</a> in <a href="Randalstown">Randalstown</a>, <a href="County%20Antrim">County Antrim</a>, <a href="Northern%20Ireland">Northern Ireland</a>. It is an 11-16 Catholic, all ability, co-educational college which mainly serves families from the parishes of <a href="Randalstown">Randalstown</a> and <a href="Antrim%2C%20County%20Antrim">Antrim</a>.
History.
The college is a result of the amalgamation of <a href="St%20Malachy%27s%20High%20School%2C%20Antrim">St Malachy's High School, Antrim</a> and <a href="St%20Olcan%27s%20High%20School">St Olcan's High School</a> in Randalstown. This was agreed in March 2006. The combined school was renamed as "St Benedict's College". St Malachy's High School was demolished and a rebuilding programme began on the St Olcan's site around the same time to develop new facilities.
